tutorial.speak:
Welcome to the Chums Automations tutorial. Automations help you streamline your church's workflows by automatically performing tasks based on specific triggers.
To get started with automations, navigate to the Chums dashboard and click on the Settings icon.
In the Settings menu, find and click on Automations.
You'll see a list of your existing automations. To create a new one, click the Add Automation button in the top right corner.
First, give your automation a descriptive name. This helps you identify its purpose later.
Next, choose a trigger. Triggers are events that start your automation, such as when someone joins a group or when a task is completed.
After selecting a trigger, you'll need to configure its specific settings. For example, if you chose "Person joins group" as your trigger, you'll need to select which group.
Now, add the actions that should occur when the trigger happens. Click Add Action to see the available options.
Common actions include sending an email, creating a task, or adding a person to a group. Select the action you want to perform.
Configure the details of your chosen action. For example, if you're sending an email, you'll need to write the subject and message.
You can add multiple actions to a single automation. They will execute in the order you add them.
Before saving, review your automation settings to ensure everything is configured correctly.
Click Save to activate your automation. It will now run automatically whenever the trigger conditions are met.
To manage existing automations, you can edit, pause, or delete them from the main automations list.
You can also view the history of your automations to see when they've been triggered and what actions were taken.
